sen.j: 三条大橋（さんじょうおおはし）は京都市にある三条通の橋。
sen.e: Sanjo-ohashi Bridge is a part of Sanjo-dori Street.
Sanjo-ohashi Bridge is on Sanjo-dori Street.
Sanjo-ohashi Bridge is on Sanjo-dori Street in Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: スペース削除in Kyoto City補足

sen.j: 鴨川にかかっており、東海道と中山道の終点である。
sen.e: Sanjo-ohashi Bridge is over Kamo-gawa River, and it forms the terminal of both Tokaido and Nakasendo.
Sanjo-ohashi Bridge runs over Kamo-gawa River, and it is where both the Tokaido and the Nakasendo meet.
Sanjo-ohashi Bridge runs over the Kamo-gawa River, and it is where both the Tokaido and the Nakasendo meet.
sen.cmt: "Kamo-gawa River"→"the Kamo-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 橋が架けられた時期は明らかではないが、豊臣秀吉の命により改修された記録があり、欄干には当時の擬宝珠も一部残っている。
sen.e: Although when it was built is unknown, there is a record that says Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ordered to renovate the bridge, on which some ornamental railing tops made at that time remain today.

Although it is unknown when it was built, there is a record in which it states Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ordered the renovatation of the bridge, and some ornamental railing tops made at that time remain today.

Although it is unknown when it was built, there is a record in which it states Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI ordered the renovation of the bridge, and some ornamental railing tops made at that time remain today.

sen.j: 現在の橋本体は2車線、歩道付のコンクリート製で1950年（昭和25年）に作られた。
sen.e: The bridge now is two-track with sidewalks, and the main body of it was rebuilt of concrete in 1950.
The bridge now has two lanes with sidewalks, and the main body of it was rebuilt of concrete in 1950.

sen.j: 日本で最初の駅伝がここからスタートした。
sen.e: The first Ekiden in the history of Japan put its starting line on this bridge.
The first Ekiden in the history of Japan had its starting line on this bridge.
The first Ekiden in the history of Japan had its starting line on this bridge.

sen.j: 東海道中膝栗毛の弥次さん喜多さんの像がある。
sen.e: Statues of Yaji-san and Kita-san from Tokaido chu Hizakurige are at the end of this bridge.
Statues of Yaji-san and Kita-san from Tokaido chu Hizakurige are at the end of this bridge.

A pair of statues of Yaji-san and Kita-san, two characters from a story called 'Tokai Dochu Hizakurige' (a humorous adventure story of two men who travel along the Tokaido highway on a pilgrimage to Ise shrine in Edo Period) are at the end of this bridge.
sen.cmt: Tokaido chu Hizakurige に英語の説明をつけました。

sen.j: 橋の東側には江戸時代の勤皇思想家である高山彦九郎像（俗称・土下座像）があり、待ち合わせスポットになっている。
sen.e: At the east side of the bridge is a statue of Hikokuro TAKAYAMA of Edo Period (so commonly called: prostrating himself on the ground) who was a loyal supporter of the Emperor then, and it is now a meeting spot.

At the east side of the bridge there is a statue of Hikokuro TAKAYAMA who was a loyal supporter of the Emperor in the Edo Period (the so called 'dogezazo': a statue of him prostrating himself on the ground), and it is now a meeting spot.
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。If you translate 'so called' I think we need the Japanese word and the meaning in English.
